title: Authors and Citation
text: Juan Carlos Villaseñor-Derbez. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Villaseñor-Derbez J (2025). EVR628tools: Package (Title Case). R package version 0.1.0, https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {EVR628tools: What the Package Does (Title Case)},   author = {Juan Carlos Villaseñor-Derbez},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://jcvdav.github.io/EVR628tools/}, }

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: EVR628tools contains series datasets, palettes, functions help instruction EVR 528 / 628 Introduction Data Management Visualization Environmental Scientists.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: can install development version EVR628tools like :
code: # install.packages("pak") #In case you don't have pak installed pak::pak("jcvdav/EVR628tools)

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: package contains functions preface data_* palette_*. following example uses one . Take look Reference see full list datasts functions available. task hand simple. ’ll use EVR628tools::data_lionfish data make plot showing fish size (length weight) varies depth using scatterplot. ’ll use EVR628tools::palette_UM() color palette color points site. recommend look documentation data ?EVR628tools::data_lionfish color palette EVR628tools::palette_UM() running code. Sample figure using data color palettes EVR628tools package. x-axis shows depth collection (m) y-axis shows fish total length (cm). Marker size idnicates wet weight fish, marker color site sampled.
code: library(ggplot2)  # First, inspect the data head(EVR628tools::data_lionfish) #> # A tibble: 6 × 8 #>   id     site    lat   lon total_length_mm total_weight_gr depth_m temperature_C #>   <chr>  <chr> <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>           <dbl>   <dbl>         <dbl> #> 1 001-P… Para…  20.5 -87.2             213           113.     38.1            28 #> 2 002-P… Para…  20.5 -87.2             124            27.6    27.9            28 #> 3 003-P… Pared  20.5 -87.2             166            52.3    18.5            28 #> 4 004-C… Cano…  20.5 -87.2             203           123.     15.5            28 #> 5 005-C… Cano…  20.5 -87.2             212           129      15              28 #> 6 006-P… Paam…  20.5 -87.2             210           139.     22.7            29  # Now let's build a plot ggplot(data = EVR628tools::data_lionfish,        mapping = aes(x = depth_m,                      y = total_length_mm,                      size = total_weight_gr,                      fill = site)) +   geom_point(shape = 21, color = 1) +   scale_fill_manual(values = EVR628tools::palette_UM(n = 10)) +   theme_bw() +   labs(x = "Depth (m)",        y = "Total Length (mm)",        size = "Total Weight (gr)",        fill = "Site")

title: Create standard project directories — create_dirs
text: Creates set standard directories repository: scripts, data (subdirectories raw, processed, output) results (subdirectories img tab)

title: Create standard project directories — create_dirs
text: Borrowed old startR package https://github.com/emlab-ucsb/startR/blob/master/R/create_local_dirs.R

title: Create standard project directories — create_dirs
text: other_dirs needed, character vector containing names extra directories.

title: Create standard project directories — create_dirs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ create_dirs() # This creates default directories  create_dirs(other_dirs = "docs") # Creates all default directories and a "docs" directory } # }

what: Apparent fishing effort in the Gulf of Mexico — data_fishing_effort
title: Apparent fishing effort in the Gulf of Mexico — data_fishing_effort
text: Monthly AIS-derived dishing effort Gulf Mexico 2024

title: Apparent fishing effort in the Gulf of Mexico — data_fishing_effort
Apparent fishing effort in the Gulf of Mexico — data_fishing_effort
text: ## `data_fishing_effort` data frame 14,038 rows 6 columns: year Numeric - Year observation month Numeric - Month observation lat Numeric - Latitude decimal degrees indicating center pixel activity took place lon Numeric - Longitude decimal degrees indicating center pixel activity took place effort_vessels Numeric - Fishing effort measured number fishing vessels infered fishing location temperature_C Numeric - Fishing effort measured apparent fishing hours location

title: Apparent fishing effort in the Gulf of Mexico — data_fishing_effort
text: Data generated using `gfwr` package https://github.com/GlobalFishingWatch/gfwr. See also Kroodsma et al. "Tracking global footprint fisheries." Science 359.6378 (2018): 904-908.

title: Lionfish biometry — data_lionfish
text: Biometric measurements 109 lionfish (_Pterois volitans_) captured Puerto Aventuras (Mexico). Data also include spatial environmental variables.

title: Lionfish biometry — data_lionfish
text: ## `data_lionfish` data frame 109 rows 8 columns: id Character - unique alpha-numeric code identoifying organism site Character - Name dive site organism collected lat Numeric - Latitude decimal degrees lon Numeric - Longitude decimal degrees total_length_mm Numeric - Total length organism, measured milimiters total_weight_gr Numeric - Total weight (also known wet weight) organism, measured milimiters depth_m Numeric - Depth organism collected, meters temperature_C Numeric - Water temperature time collection, °C

title: Lionfish biometry — data_lionfish
text: Villaseñor-Derbez, J.C. & Herrera-Pérez, R. Brief description prey selectivity ontogenetic changes diet invasive lionfish _Pterois volitans_ (Actinopterygii, Scorpaenidae) Mexican Caribbean. Pan-American Journal Aquatic Sciences. (2014), 9(2):131-135.

title: Hurricane tracks for Milton (2024) — data_milton
text: Observed hurricane track (lat, lon, timestamp) center storm Milton 2024

title: Hurricane tracks for Milton (2024) — data_milton
text: ## `data_milton` data frame 62 rows 7 columns: name Character - Storm name given agency iso_time POSIXct - Time provided Universal Time Coordinates (UTC). Format YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss points provided 6 hour intervals. lat Numeric - Latitude decimal degrees lon Numeric - Longitude decimal degrees wind_speed Numeric - Maximum sustained wind speed knots: 0 - 300 kts. (1-min. mean) pressure Numeric - Minimum sea level pressure, 850 - 1050 mb. sshs Character - Saffir–Simpson hurricane scale. values defined follows:   -5 = Unknown   -4 = Post-tropical   -3 = Miscellaneous disturbances   -2 = Subtropical   Tropical systems classified based wind speeds   -1 = Tropical depression (W<34)   0 = Tropical storm (34<W<64)   1 = Category 1 (64<=W<83)   2 = Category 2 (83<=W<96)   3 = Category 3 (96<=W<113)   4 = Category 4 (113<=W<137)   5 = Category 5 (W >= 137)

title: Hurricane tracks for Milton (2024) — data_milton
text: https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/products/international-best-track-archive

title: Sea Surface Temperature — data_sst
text: Mean daily Sea Surface Temperature (°C) derived 0.5° resolution imagery within bounding box (lon_min = -81, lon_max = -79.75, lat_min = 25.25, lat_max = 25.75).

title: Sea Surface Temperature — data_sst
text: ## `data_sst` data frame 2,922 rows two columns: date Date - Date observation, yyyy-mm-dd format temperature_C Numeric - Mean sea surface temperatrure, measured °C

title: Sea Surface Temperature — data_sst
text: Raw data come NOAA AVHRR Optimum Interpolation v2.1 - SST https://coastwatch.pfeg.noaa.gov/erddap/griddap/ncdcOisst21Agg_LonPM180.html. script generate data https://github.com/jcvdav/EVR628tools/blob/main/data-raw/data_sst.R

title: Sea Surface Temperature — data_sst
code: library(EVR628tools) library(ggplot2) # Look at the first 10 rows head(data_sst, 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 2 #>    date       temperature_C #>    <date>             <dbl> #>  1 2000-01-01          24.9 #>  2 2000-01-02          24.8 #>  3 2000-01-03          25.2 #>  4 2000-01-04          25.4 #>  5 2000-01-05          25.5 #>  6 2000-01-06          25.6 #>  7 2000-01-07          25.6 #>  8 2000-01-08          25.5 #>  9 2000-01-09          25.5 #> 10 2000-01-10          25.7 # Make a time series plot ggplot(data = EVR628tools::data_sst,        mapping = aes(x = date, y = temperature_C)) +        geom_line()

title: Sea Surface Temperature Anomaly — data_sst_anom
text: Sea Surface Temperature (°C) derived 0.5° resolution imagery within bounding box (lon_min = -81, lon_max = -79.75, lat_min = 25.25, lat_max = 25.75) 2024, relative 2000-2023 values.

title: Sea Surface Temperature Anomaly — data_sst_anom
text: ## `data_sst_anom` data.frame 9 rowns two columns: lat Numeric - Latitude decimal degrees indicating center pixel lon Numeric - Longitude decimal degrees indicating center pixel temperature_anomaly_C Numeric - Sea surface temperatrure anomaly relative daily 2000-2023 values, measured °C

title: Sea Surface Temperature Anomaly — data_sst_anom
text: Raw data come NOAA AVHRR Optimum Interpolation v2.1 - SST https://coastwatch.pfeg.noaa.gov/erddap/griddap/ncdcOisst21Agg_LonPM180.html. script generate data https://github.com/jcvdav/EVR628tools/blob/main/data-raw/data_sst.R

title: Sea Surface Temperature Anomaly — data_sst_anom
code: # Look at the first 10 rows head(EVR628tools::data_sst_anom, 10) #> # A tibble: 9 × 3 #>    latitude longitude mean_2024_temperature_C #>   <dbl[1d]> <dbl[1d]>                   <dbl> #> 1      25.4     -80.1                     NaN #> 2      25.4     -79.9                     NaN #> 3      25.4     -79.6                     NaN #> 4      25.6     -80.1                     NaN #> 5      25.6     -79.9                     NaN #> 6      25.6     -79.6                     NaN #> 7      25.9     -80.1                     NaN #> 8      25.9     -79.9                     NaN #> 9      25.9     -79.6                     NaN

what: IPCC color palette for SSPs — palette_IPCC_ssp
title: IPCC color palette for SSPs — palette_IPCC_ssp
text: Default colors Shared Socio-economic Pathways (SSPs), indicated IPCC AR6 WGI style guide

title: IPCC color palette for SSPs — palette_IPCC_ssp
IPCC color palette for SSPs — palette_IPCC_ssp
text: Page 9 form IPCC style guide: https://www.ipcc.ch/site/assets/uploads/2022/09/IPCC_AR6_WGI_VisualStyleGuide_2022.pdf

title: IPCC color palette for SSPs — palette_IPCC_ssp
text: ssp character vector specifying SSPs required. Options `"SSP5-8.5"`, `"SSP3-7.0"`, `"SSP2-4.5"`, `"SSP1-2.6"` `"SSP1-1.9"`

title: IPCC color palette for SSPs — palette_IPCC_ssp
text: NAMED vector containing pairs SSP names colors.

title: IPCC color palette for SSPs — palette_IPCC_ssp

what: IPCC color palette for Sea Surface Temperature — palette_IPCC_temp
title: IPCC color palette for Sea Surface Temperature — palette_IPCC_temp
text: Default colors Sea Surface Temperature, indicated IPCC AR6 WGI style guide, using divergent color palette

title: IPCC color palette for Sea Surface Temperature — palette_IPCC_temp
IPCC color palette for Sea Surface Temperature — palette_IPCC_temp
text: Page 8 2019 ICPP Style guide: https://www.ipcc.ch/site/assets/uploads/2019/04/IPCC-visual-style-guide.pdf Mark Harrower & Cynthia . Brewer (2003) ColorBrewer.org: Online Tool Selecting Colour Schemes forMaps, Cartographic Journal, 40:1, 27-37, DOI: 10.1179/000870403235002042

title: IPCC color palette for Sea Surface Temperature — palette_IPCC_temp
text: character vector containing 11 colors,

title: IPCC color palette for Sea Surface Temperature — palette_IPCC_temp
UM Color palette — palette_UM
text: discrete color palette 10 colors based Unviersity Miami's color identity guidelines.

title: UM Color palette — palette_UM
text: See University Miami's Visual Identity Cues Web: https://webcomm.miami.edu/resources/identity/color/index.html

title: UM Color palette — palette_UM
text: n integer. Number colors return, maximum 10. require_WCAG boolean specifying whether colors returned comply Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2 Level AA Conformance (See https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG2AA-Conformance). Defaults FALSE.

title: UM Color palette — palette_UM
text: string HEX color values
